messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:32): And ones where the deep nesting is caused by AAA
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:35): When do you hit 'Insert last node into node, first removing it from its previous parent node if any.' in AAA?

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:49): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Try putting a 'raise' in the part of html5lib that implements that step, then run the tests, and hope someone already wrote a test for it :-)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (14:53): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: is the *[irrelevant] used anywhere?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:55): <cite><b><cite><i><cite><i><cite><i><div>X</b>TEST
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:55): Or simply:
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:55): <DIV> abc <B> def <I> ghi <P> jkl </B>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:00): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: not sure
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:01): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: <div>abc<b>def<i>ghi<p>jki</p></i></b><i><p>ghi</i></p>
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:01): or something?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:02): http://pastebin.com/m6568f05d
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:02): But I don't care atm about the final result
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:03): is wrong anyway
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:12): Huh
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (15:12): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: anyway, it was renamed to hidden and ie6 will drop the ruleset because there's an attribute selector
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:13): So the above fragment runs through AAA twice
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:13): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: good point. I didn't consider the renaming.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:23): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Why would you need to keep track of why a text nodef was flushed and foster-parented?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:24): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: if foster-parenting normally doesn't coalesce
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:24): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: and if I flush at the end of a packet boundary
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:25): Ah
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:32): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: thanks for looking at the AAA
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:40): argleblarg I hate windows that can go behind things but don't put an entry in the taskbar.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:01): http://www.dabs.com/ is incompatible with what's currently specced about defer scripts

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:03): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I now have an A4 piece of paper with scribbles of me trying to find something that would create adjacent text nodes all over it :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:04): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, does the site have other, non-deferred scripts relying on the variables set inside the deferred script?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:07): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: I haven't investigated
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:07): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: the script is https://seal.globalsign.com/SiteSeal/gs_image_100-50_en.js
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:07): whose purpose seems to be merely to write a Verisign badge
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (16:08): oh, I didn't see the document.write() in there before. I thought it was just declaring a few variables and a function
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:08): argh. they even sniff for Firefox 3.5
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:08): and assume "and higher" has the same behavior as 3.5
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:10): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I want to talk to you about html5lib sometime, FYI
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:13): ooh. It's because I have a browser that implements defer but doesn't have Firefox in the UA string
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:16): Web authors should know that the moment they look for "Firefox" or "Safari" in the UA string, they are writing a bug
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:19): I'm annoyed at sites that check for "Firefox", but this is way worse than the usual stuff that e.g. Google does
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:20): at least Wave and Google Maps still let me click through
